author: kfogel
msg: Continue renames begun in r8735:
* doc/book/book/appb.xml: New file, renamed from...
* doc/book/book/appc.xml: ...here, which is now temporarily removed.

author: kfogel
msg: Step 1 of N in removing most of cvs2svn material from the book.
This is part of a general shifting of the appendices.  We're removing
most of the content about cvs2svn and replacing it with pointers to
more up-to-date information, since cvs2svn is still changing.  The
pointers don't deserve their own appendix, so the current Appendix B,
which is dedicated to cvs2svn, will just go away, and the new
information (including mentions of the other converter tools) will go
in "Third Party Tools", with a ref from "Subversion For CVS Users".
Due to issue #1516, I can't do all these renames at once, hence there
will be several commits.
* doc/book/book/appb.xml: Removed.
* doc/book/book/ch05.xml: Anticipate new link to cvs2svn information.
The new link is bogus until this change is finished, of course.

author: ghudson
msg: Add a --tunnel-user argument to svnserve, to allow a single account to
be used by multiple committers using ssh's command directive.  Also
allows tunneling to a server which doesn't provide APR_HAS_USER.
Idea and initial implementation by Tommi Virtanen; reworked by me.
* svnserve/main.c (svnserve__options, main): Add tunnel-user option.
* svnserve/server.h (serve_params_t): Add tunnel_user parameter.
* svnserve/serve.c
(server_baton_t): Add tunnel_user field.  (We can't quite remove
the tunnel field; it's still used at commit time to decide whether
to perform deltification synchronously.)
(send_mechs, auth): Remove the logic for computing the tunnel user
or deciding whether we will be able to compute it; just test
whether tunnel_user is set in the server baton.
(get_tunnel_user): New function to precompute the tunnel user in
anticipation of EXTERNAL authentication.  Use the provided tunnel
user parameter if given.
(server): Set b.tunnel_user using get_tunnel_user().
* svnserve/svnserve.8: Document --tunnel-user.
